snippet: While computers connecting to the Internet through a dial-up telephone line are usually less of a target for hackers than computers using faster, persistent broadband connections, it never hurts to be as protected as possible.
abstract: While computers connecting to the Internet through a dial-up telephone line are usually less of a target for hackers than computers using faster, persistent broadband connections, it never hurts to be as protected as possible.

headline.main: Q&A: Staying Safe at Any Speed
headline.print_headline: Q&A: Staying Safe At Any Speed
